metadata.description: Consolidated ECI voter service forms dataset for intent-based routing, document checklist generation, and process guidance.

Form-6.title: Application for New Voter Registration
Form-6.legal_reference: Rules 13(1) and 13(26) of the Registration of Electors Rules, 1960
Form-6.purpose: Inclusion of name in the electoral roll for first-time voters or those not enrolled anywhere.
who_should_use: Citizens not enrolled in any electoral roll
Citizens who have never registered before
Form-6.addressed_to: Electoral Registration Officer (ERO) of the applicant's Assembly Constituency

key_fields.applicant_name: Full name in official language and English block letters
key_fields.relative_details: Father / Mother / Husband / Wife / Legal Guardian / Guru (for third gender)
key_fields.contact: Mobile and email of self or listed relative
key_fields.aadhaar: Aadhaar number or reason for non-furnishing
key_fields.disability_details: Optional — Locomotive, Visual, Deaf & Dumb, Other
key_fields.family_member_in_roll: Name, relationship, EPIC number of existing enrolled family member

required_documents.photograph: One recent unsigned passport size color photograph (4.5cm x 3.5cm, white background, frontal face)
age_proof_any_one: Class X or XII certificate with DOB
address_proof_any_one: Water / electricity / gas connection bill (at least 1 year old)
Revenue department land records / Kisan Bahi
required_documents.notes: All documents must be self-attested copies. Field verification will be conducted if no document is available.

Form-6.declaration_penalty: False declaration punishable under Section 31 of Representation of the People Act, 1950 — imprisonment up to 1 year or fine or both
Form-6.accessibility_note: For persons with intellectual disability, autism, cerebral palsy, or multiple disabilities — signature or left thumb impression of the person or their legal guardian is accepted as per RPWD Act 2016.

Form-6A.title: Application for Inclusion of Name by Overseas Elector
Form-6A.legal_reference: Rule 8B of Registration of Electors Rules, 1960
Form-6A.purpose: Registration as an overseas (NRI) voter in the constituency where the applicant's Indian passport address is located.
who_should_use: Must NOT have acquired citizenship of any foreign country
Must have completed 18 years as on 1st January of the year of application
Form-6A.addressed_to: Electoral Registration Officer of the Assembly/Parliamentary Constituency

key_fields.personal: Name, last name, relative's name, DOB, place of birth, gender
key_fields.india_address: Address as mentioned in Indian passport
key_fields.passport_details: Passport number, place of issue, date of issue and expiry
key_fields.visa_details: Visa number, date of issue/expiry, type, issuing authority
key_fields.current_address_abroad: Full address in country of residence

required_documents.photograph: One recent passport size photo (3.5cm x 3.5cm, white/light background, full face)
passport_copies_self_attested: Page with applicant photo and personal details
Page with address in India (as in passport)
Page with current valid visa endorsement
required_documents.if_in_person: Original passport must be produced for verification (returned immediately after)

Form-6A.voting_note: After enrolment, overseas voter must be physically present at the polling station with original passport on poll day to cast vote.
Form-6A.declaration_penalty: False declaration punishable under Section 31 of Representation of the People Act, 1950
undertakings: Will immediately inform ERO if Indian citizenship is renounced
Will inform ERO of any change in overseas address
Will inform ERO upon returning to ordinary residence in India

Form-7.title: Application for Objection for Proposed Inclusion / Deletion of Name in Electoral Roll
Form-7.legal_reference: Rules 13(2) and 13(26) of the Registration of Electors Rules, 1960
Form-7.purpose: To raise objection to proposed inclusions or to request deletion of a name from the electoral roll.
who_should_use: Any registered voter who wants to report an incorrect/fraudulent entry
Family members requesting deletion of a deceased voter
Voters requesting deletion of their own name (e.g., shifted permanently)
Form-7.addressed_to: Electoral Registration Officer (ERO) of the Assembly Constituency

delete_existing.description: Request deletion of a name already in the current roll

object_proposed_inclusion.description: Object to a proposed new inclusion in the roll

key_fields.person_subject_to_objection: Name, surname, EPIC number, full address

Form-7.declaration_penalty: False declaration punishable under Section 31 of Representation of the People Act, 1950 — imprisonment up to 1 year or fine or both
Form-7.accessibility_note: Persons with intellectual disability, autism, cerebral palsy, or multiple disabilities may use legal guardian's signature.

Form-8.title: Application for Shifting of Residence / Correction of Entries / Replacement of EPIC / Marking of PwD
Form-8.legal_reference: Rules 13(3) and 13(26) of the Registration of Electors Rules, 1960
Form-8.purpose: Multiple voter service update requests — address change, name/details correction, EPIC replacement, or PwD disability marking.
who_should_use: Voters who have shifted residence within or across constituency
Voters with incorrect details (name, DOB, gender, photo, etc.) in the roll
Voters whose EPIC is lost, destroyed, or mutilated
Voters with disabilities seeking PwD marking on EPIC
Form-8.addressed_to: Electoral Registration Officer (ERO) of the Assembly Constituency

section_1_shifting_of_residence.action: Name deleted from old address and added at new address; replacement EPIC issued
required_address_proof_any_one: Water / electricity / gas bill (at least 1 year old)
Current passbook of nationalised/scheduled bank or Post Office
Revenue department land records including Kisan Bahi

section_2_correction_of_entries.applicable_when: Any detail in the electoral roll is incorrect
section_2_correction_of_entries.required: Self-attested documentary proof for each correction
section_2_correction_of_entries.photo_correction: New passport size photo (4.5cm x 3.5cm, white background) required only if photo is being changed

section_3_replacement_epic.applicable_when: Original EPIC is lost, destroyed, or mutilated
if_lost_or_destroyed: Attach copy of FIR / police report
Submit undertaking to return EPIC if recovered

section_4_marking_pwd.applicable_when: Voter has a disability and wants it marked on EPIC
section_4_marking_pwd.required: Disability certificate with percentage of disability

Form-8.aadhaar_field: Aadhaar number required; if unavailable, reason must be stated
Form-8.declaration_penalty: False declaration punishable under Section 31 of Representation of the People Act, 1950 — imprisonment up to 1 year or fine or both
Form-8.accessibility_note: Persons with intellectual disability, autism, cerebral palsy, or multiple disabilities may use legal guardian's signature as per RPWD Act 2016.

Form-12C.title: Letter of Intimation to Assistant Returning Officer for Notified Class of Electors
Form-12C.legal_reference: Rule 27-C of the Conduct of Elections Rules, 1961
Form-12C.purpose: Intimation by notified class of electors (migrants — registered/government employees/pensioners) to cast vote at a special polling station in their area of current residence.
who_should_use: Migrants registered with a government authority
Government employees serving away from home constituency
Pensioners drawing pension from a treasury/bank away from home constituency

part_I.title: Letter of Intimation by Applicant
part_I.addressed_to: Assistant Returning Officer (for notified class of electors)

fields.applicant_details: Name, relation, place of ordinary residence
fields.pensioner_details: Pension account number, treasury/bank address (if applicable)

part_II.title: Certificate by Attesting Officer
part_II.certifier: Officer in-charge of migrant camp/office/area OR head of office where applicant serves OR treasury officer/bank manager OR any Gazetted Officer
part_II.content: Certifies that particulars given in Part I are correct as per records

Form-12C.note: Strike off whichever is not applicable. Substituted vide Notification No. S.O. 628(E), dated 4th August, 1999.

Form-M.title: Letter of Intimation to Assistant Returning Officer for Migrant Voters
Form-M.purpose: Migrant voters wishing to cast vote in person at a special polling station in their current city/location can submit this intimation to the ARO.
who_should_use: Migrant voters enrolled in their home constituency but currently residing elsewhere
Can submit for self and family members on a single form (up to 4 voters)
Form-M.certification: Applicant certifies that all particulars given are correct to the best of their knowledge and belief.
Form-M.note: This form is for in-person voting at a migrant polling station. It does not change the voter's registered constituency.

common_resources.online_form_submission: All forms (except Form-M and Form-12C) can be submitted online via voters.eci.gov.in or nvsp.in
common_resources.acknowledgement_note: All submitted forms generate an Acknowledgement Number. Use it to track application status on voters.eci.gov.in.
